examples.translation: There is no reason to worry.

collocations: mencari alasan (to look for a reason)

usage_notes.explanation: 'Alasan' is used to explain why something happened or why someone did something. It can be a genuine reason or an excuse. The context usually indicates whether it's a valid reason or just an attempt to avoid responsibility.

examples.incorrect: Saya punya alasan untuk pergi. karena hujan.
examples.correct: Saya punya alasan untuk pergi, karena hujan.
examples.note: The comma is important to separate the two clauses. Also, it is more common to say 'Alasan saya pergi adalah karena hujan.'
'Bagus' (good, nice) is more commonly used than 'baik' (good, proper) in this context.

derivatives: mencari alasan (to look for a reason)

readability_explanation.text: 'Alasan' is a common word used in everyday conversation to explain why something is the way it is, or why someone did something. It can mean a real reason or just an excuse. Pay attention to the context to know which one it is.

example_sentences.sentence: Dia tidak datang ke pesta tanpa alasan.
example_sentences.translation: He didn't come to the party without a reason.

example_sentences.sentence: Alasan utama saya memilih universitas ini adalah karena reputasinya.
example_sentences.translation: My main reason for choosing this university is its reputation.
Don't make excuses! Finish your work.
What's your excuse for being late?
